intro: Neobartlettia sobralioides, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a striking member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet, often with a distinctive yellow throat. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Neobartlettia sobralioides is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and ability to bloom reliably under the right conditions.
